story.title: 12 seconds of gunfire: the true story of a school shooting
description: “12 seconds of gunfire: The true story of a school shooting” is a powerful virtual reality (VR) film that premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival in 2019. It was illustrated and animated entirely in VR and then rendered as a 360 video and as a traditional theatrical short film. It has played in both formats at film festivals around the world.

The short film recounts what happened to Jacob Hall and Ava Olsen, who were first-graders when a 14-year-old boy opened fire on their school playground at recess. It uses VR to take the viewer through the circumstances surrounding this tragedy.
